alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 11:45PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 245 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Frenchman Creek, Patent Creek, North Fork Frenchman Creek, Wildhorse Creek and Sandy Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haxtun, Paoli, Fairfield and Highland Center.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
